messages.content: You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Congestion and cough.
Hello, how are you today?
Not good.
What happened?
I have a lot of congestion. I also am coughing a lot. It feels like I am choking on something.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: At home lives mom, dad, a 2-1/2-year-old brother, and a 5-1/2-year-old maternal stepbrother.  Both brothers at home are sick with cold symptoms including diarrhea and vomiting.  The brother (2-1/2-year-old) was seen in the ER tonight with this patient and discharged home with an albuterol prescription.  A nephew of the mom with an ear infection.  Mom also states that she herself was sick with the flu soon after delivery.  There has been recent travel exposure to dad's family over the Christmas holidays.  At this time, there is also exposure to indoor cats and dogs.  This patient also has positive smoking exposure coming from mom.
My two and half year old son and five and half year old stepson are sick at home, they got a cold, diarrhea and are vomiting.
So, they saw a doctor?
Yes, the little one was taken up to E R and they gave him an inhaler of albuterol.
Is he getting sick because of me? I was sick with flu soon after delivery.
Nephew is sick too.
Did you travel anywhere recently?
Around Christmas time we visited dad's family. They had indoor cats and dogs.
Anyone smokes at home?
Yes, I do smoke.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: A 51-year-old white male diagnosed with PTLD in latter half of 2007.  He presented with symptoms of increasing adenopathy, abdominal pain, weight loss, and anorexia.  He did not seek medical attention immediately.  He was finally hospitalized by the renal transplant service and underwent a lymph node biopsy in the groin, which showed diagnosis of large cell lymphoma.  He was discussed at the hematopathology conference.  Chemotherapy with rituximab plus cyclophosphamide, daunorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone was started.  First cycle of chemotherapy was complicated by sepsis despite growth factor support.  He also appeared to have become disoriented either secondary to sepsis or steroid therapy. The patient has received 5 cycles of chemotherapy to date.  He did not keep his appointment for a PET scan after 3 cycles because he was not feeling well.  His therapy has been interrupted for infection related to squamous cell cancer, skin surgery as well as complaints of chest infection. The patient is here for the sixth and final cycle of chemotherapy.  He states he feels well.  He denies any nausea, vomiting, cough, shortness of breath, chest pain or fatigue.  He denies any tingling or numbness in his fingers.  Review of systems is otherwise entirely negative. Performance status on the ECOG scale is 1.
Good afternoon, sir. My chart here says that you are a fifty one year old white male, is that correct?
Good afternoon, doctor. Yes, all of that is correct.
Great, thank you. Please, walk me through the history of your symptoms, when did everything begin.
Well, I was diagnosed with P T L D towards the end of two thousand seven.
What symptoms were you experiencing?
I had swollen lymph nodes, stomach pain, I was losing a lot of weight, and I wasn't really eating.
How have you been treated for this?
Well, I didn't go to the doctor right away, but eventually I went to the hospital, and they did a biopsy of my groin lymph nodes, and they found large scale lymphoma.
Who's care were you under in the hospital?
Um, it was the renal transplant services. Oh yeah, they talked about my case at the hematopathology conference.
That's interesting. After you were diagnosed, what treatments were you given?
Um, I started chemo with, um, I have it written down, cyclophosphamide, daunorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone.
Did you have any complications with chemo?
Um, yeah, I had sepsis during my first cycle, they said that I had it even with growth factor support. I was also disoriented.
How many cycles of chemo have you completed?
I've done five to date.
Did you have your P E T Scan after your first three cycles?
No, I wasn't feeling well at all, so I didn't go.
Has your chemotherapy been interrupted for any other reason?
Yeah, I had an infection related to the skin cancer, and a chest infection, sir.
Did you have surgery for the skin cancer?
Yes, I did.
Okay, and you're here for your sixth round of chemo, correct?
Yes, that's correct.
How are you feeling today?
Overall, I feel pretty well.
Are you having any cold or flu like symptoms today?
No.
Any shortness of breath, or chest pain?
No, doctor.
Finally, your E C O G score is one according to the nurse, is that correct?
Yes, doctor. That's correct.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: None by history.
Do you have any known history of allergies?
No, I don't have any allergies.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Urinary tract infection, the patient was started on Macrodantin 100 mg orally every six hours for urinary tract infection secondary to Enterococcus species.
Are you taking Macrodantin?
Yes, I am.
For your urine infection, right?
Yes.
One hundred M G?
I think so.
Okay so you had U T I because of the bacteria named Enterococcus.
Yes, and I am taking the medicine religiously every six hours.
Great!
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: None.
Are there any major medical conditions in your past that I should be aware of?
No, but what do you mean by that?
Well, anything from high blood pressure, to cancer, to depression. Do any of those sound familiar?
Oh, no I don't have any of those.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: RESPIRATORY: No history of shortness of breath, no history of asthma, no history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, no history of obstructive sleep apnea.
Do you feel any shortness of breath?
No.
Any snoring or sleep disorder like interrupted breathing?
Um, no.
Any history of asthma or lung disease?
No.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: In 1985, he had removal of a testicle due to enlarged testicle, he is not quite sure of the cause but he states it was not cancer. REVI
Have you ever had surgery, sir?
Yeah, I had one of my testicles removed int he summer of eighty five.
Do you remember the reason it needed to be removed?
They just told me it was enlarged, but I don't know much more.
Was it cancerous?
No, they weren't sure what was the cause, but they told me it wasn't cancer.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Her past medical history is significant for injury to her left shoulder, gastroesophageal reflux disorder, diabetes, anxiety, and osteoporosis.
Hello, miss. Before we begin, I just want to confirm some information with you.
Sounds good.
You had this injury on your left shoulder recently, right?
Yeah, that's correct.
Are you still experiencing G E R D?
Oh, yeah. I can't drink coffee anymore.
That's awful. Coffee is what keeps me alive. Are you still experiencing anxiety?
Yeah, I am.
Two more questions. Is your blood sugar still high?
I think so.
You currently have osteoporosis, correct?
That's correct.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Pulmonary embolism in 1997 which had been treated with thrombolysis in Germany. She reported that she had been on warfarin for 6 months after her diagnosis.  Recurrent venous thromboembolism in 1999 at which time an IVC filter had been placed.  Psoriasis.  She denied any history of miscarriage.
Please fill me in regarding your past medical history.
I had a blood clot in my lung. This was back when I was living in Germany.
How long ago was that?
Um, nineteen ninety seven. I think?
How did they treat you for the blood clot?
I believe they used thrombolysis and I took Warfarin for six months.
Have you experienced any other blood clotting issues?
Yes. I have had recurring clotting problems since nineteen ninety nine. They had to put a I V C filter in.
Are there any other health problems I should know about?
I have Psoriasis.
Any history of miscarriage?
No.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Huntington disease, symptoms of dementia and hypertension.  She has an upcoming appointment with the Neurologist.  Currently, does have a primary care physician and _______ having an outpatient psychiatrist, Dr. X, and her current Neurologist, Dr. Y.
I have your referral here, from your primary physician? She said that you have a history of Huntington disease and that you have been experiencing some memory loss and confusion.
Yes. That's right! I also have high blood pressure.
Are you on medication for your high blood pressure?
Yes, I am.
Can you tell me more about the memory problems you have been experiencing?
My memory has been getting worse. I can never find anything, or people keep moving my things.
She is not recognizing us more and more these days. And it takes her longer to realize what is going on. I made an appointment with the Neurologist for next week.
Who is her Neurologist?
Doctor Townsend.
Are you seeing any other specialists for your condition?
Yes, I see Doctor Smith.
What kind of doctor is Doctor Smith?
She is a psychiatrist. I have been seeing her for a long time.
Oh okay. So, she is not a psychiatrist at our facility?
No.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient denies tobacco, alcohol or illicit drug usage.
Let's go over your social history, shall we?
Go for it.
Do you drink?
Nope.
How about smoke?
Nope.
And any illegal drug use?
Definitely not.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient lives at Life Care Center. She does not smoke, drink or use intravenous drugs.
So, as you mentioned, you live in adult care center?
Yes, Life Care Center.
Okay.
It is a nice place.
Okay. Do you drink or smoke?
No, I quit a long time back.
Drugs?
No, I have never done that.
Okay.
Yeah.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: None.
Do you take any medication?
You mean prescriptions?
I mean anything at all?
No, I don't.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Marital status:   Married.   Smoking history: Smoked 1 PPD, quit 5 years ago and after smoking for 15 years.  Alcohol history: Drinks socially.   Denies any history of drug abuse.
Good morning.
Good morning, doctor.
I'm just going to need some background information before we begin. So, are you married?
Yes, to my lovely wife.
Great, do you smoke?
Well, I used to smoke about a pack a day, but I quit five years ago.
Congratulations on quitting, that's great. How long did you smoke that pack a day?
I did for about fifteen years.
Well, its good that you quit. Do you drink?
I'd say I drink socially, like if I'm at a party or a football game, something like that.
I understand. Is there any history of drug abuse?
No, absolutely not.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Spontaneous miscarriage at 3 months approximately 30 years ago.
Any history of pregnancies or miscarriages?
I had a miscarriage about thirty years ago.
How far along were you when you miscarried?
About twenty weeks.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Briefly, the patient is an 83-year-old woman with a history of progression of dysphagia for the past year, dysarthria, weakness of her right arm, cramps in her legs, and now with progressive weakness in her upper extremities.
Hello, how are you doing? How old are you?
I am an eighty three year old woman, how do you expect me to do?
Tell me, what is happening with you, what bought you here today?
I feel a lot of weakness in my both hands.
Is it something new or old?
I had difficulty in swallowing and some problems with speech too in the past. I used to have cramps in my legs and weakness only in my right arm but now it is continuously increasing in both arms.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Stable.
How are you feeling today?
Good.
Is there any issue that I should be worried of?
No.
Are you feeling condifent of your health?
Yes.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Recent history of pneumonia, urosepsis, dementia, amputation, osteoporosis, and hypothyroidism.
She recently had pneumonia and urinary tract infection which caused urosepsis.
Oh, okay and she also had amputation of her left toes?
Yes three of them due to gangrene.
Oh, I see.
She is my nurse, she stays with me.
That is good, at least she remembers you.
She does have her days when she does not recognize anyone including me.
How long has she been suffering from dementia?
For some time now, I don't know exactly.
Okay, any other medical condition?
Yes, she has a history of hypothyroidism and osteoporosis.
Hm, alright let me make a note of that.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: 1.  Hydrocarbon aspiration. 2.  Bilateral pneumonia with pneumonitis secondary to aspiration. 3.  Asplenic patient.
My diagnosis for you is aspiration pneumonia.
What kind of aspiration?
Hydrocarbon.
Okay.
And it is in both lungs that is causing infection.
Also I don't have a spleen. Please add that to the notes.
And you don't have a spleen.
Yes.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Viral gastroenteritis.
I belive you caught a virus. You have the stomach flu.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: IVC filter placement 1999.   Tubal ligation.
Any surgical history?
I had a I V C filter placed for a blood clot and a tubal ligation.
When was your I V C filter placed?
Nineteen ninety nine.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Positive for morbid obesity, chronic lymphedema of the lower extremities, at least for the last three years, spastic colon, knee arthritis, recurrent cellulitis of the lower extremities.  She has had a hysterectomy and a cholecystectomy in the remote past.
I'd like to go over your medical history with you.
Okay, what would you like to know?
Let's start with your surgical history.
I had my gallbladder removed along with my uterus several years ago.
Any complications with those surgeries?
No. I recovered sooner than I anticipated.
That's always nice.

I've been told many times in the past that I'm morbidly obese. It's never great to hear, but I'm trying my best given my current situation. I've had lymphedema in my legs for the last three years. I also suffer from arthritis.
Where's your arthritis the worst?
Probably my knees. Oh, and I've been hospitalized in the past for recurring cellulitis in my legs.
When were you last hospitalized for cellulitis?
Back in May.
And I remember reading in your chart that you were recently diagnosed with a spastic colon.
Yes, that's correct.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Possible insect bite with lymphangitis.
Your lymph node is swollen. There are many reasons why a lymph node can become swollen. Since it has only been swollen for two days, I would like to monitor it.
Okay. So, is it not a spider bite?
It is possible. Let's monitor it for now.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: MI in the past and atrial fibrillation, he said that he has had one stent put in, but he is not sure.  The last cardiologist he saw was Dr. X and his primary doctor is Dr. Y.
Did you have any heart issues in the past?
Ah yes, I had a heart attack.
Anything else?
My heart doctor said that I have something like a irregular or fast heartbeat.
Who is your heart doctor? Whom did you see last?
It is Doctor X.
So, did he put anything inside your heart or something?
Yeah, I think I have one stent put in but I don't remember properly.
Okay, and who is your primary doctor?
My primary doctors name is Doctor Y?

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Ms. A completed high school degree.  She reported that she primarily obtained B's and C's in school.  She received some tutoring for algebra in middle school, but denied ever having been held back a grade failing any classes or having any problems with attention or hyperactivity. She currently works for the Social Security Administration in data processing.  she has returned to full-time work, but continues to perform only light duties due to her physical condition.  She is now living on her own.  She has never driven.  She reported that she continues to perform ADLs independently such as cooking and cleaning.  She lost her husband in 2005 and has three adult daughters.  She previously reported some concerns that her children wanted her to move into assisted living, but she did not discuss that during this current evaluation.  She also reported number of other family members who had recently passed away.  She has returned to activities she enjoys such as quire, knitting, and cooking and plans to go on a cruise to the Bahamas at the end of October.
Hi there! How are you today, Miss A?
I am doing well.
Do you still live on your own?
Yes, I do. My husband passed away in two thousand and five. I have been on my own ever since and I am doing fine.
I remembered you telling me that your three grown daughters wanted you to move into an assisted living facility.
I think they are just scared for me to be alone, but I am doing just fine. I have had a bunch of other family members that have recently passed away. I think that made them nervus.
Are you still working?
Yes, I am. I just returned to full time again, but they put me on light duty until I am fully healed.
What is it that you do for work?
I work for Social Security Administration in data processing. All I have is a high school education. I am the kind of person that must stay busy. They give me lots of cool tasks to do.
Did you have difficulties in school?
No. I primarily got B's and C's in school. I received some tutoring for algebra in middle school, but I was never held back a grade failing any classes.
Did you ever have any problems with attention or hyperactivity?
No.
Do you drive a car?
No. I have never driven before.
Are you able to perform your daily living activities such as getting dressed, cooking and cleaning independently?
Yes. I still do all that and more.
Have you been able to continue the other activities that you enjoy?
Yes! I am in the choir at church. I am back to my knitting and cooking too. At the end of October I am going on a cruise to the Bahamas with a group of ladies from my church.
Excellent!
So many of my family members have passed away that I have realized I need to live my life to the fullest.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient admits to heavy alcohol drinking in the past, quit several years ago.  He is also a former cigarette smoker, quit several years ago.
I will ask some questions related to your social history.
Okay.
Do you drink?
I use to drink a lot, but when my drinking habit started affecting my family, I knew I need to be sober. I quit it and it was like a decade ago.
Nice, what about smoking?
Same story, I use to smoke one pack of cigarettes everyday but quit it many years ago.
Wow man! You are an inspiration. I would love to see this level of commitment in all of my patients. If only that was possible.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: MSK: The patient is ambulatory with normal and symmetric gait.  There is adequate range of motion without significant pain or deformity.
Are you able to move?
Yes, I can.
Great I can see you are walking well.
But there is pain.
It is quite normal with your situation.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: coughing up blood and severe joint pain.
Hi there! What brings you into see me today?
I have been having this bad cough. My joints started hurting really bad. I have never felt this kind of joint pain before. This morning I coughed up some blood.
Okey. I would like to start with a sputum culture, bloodwork and then a C T scan.
Okay.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Single, lives with sister, and denies Tobacco/ETOH/illicit drug use.
How are you doing today?
I am good, thank you.
Are you married?
No, I'm single.
Do you live alone or with family?
I live with my sister.
Have you ever taken any kind of illegal drugs?
Nope.
What about alcohol or smoking?
No.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: None known.
Any known allergies?
Um none that I can think of.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Hypertension treated with Cozaar 100 mg daily and Norvasc 10 mg daily.  Esophageal reflux treated with Nexium 40 mg daily.  Allergic rhinitis treated with Allegra 180 mg daily.  Sleep disturbances, depression and anxiety treated with Paxil 25 mg daily, Advair 10 mg nightly and Ativan 1 mg nightly.  Glaucoma treated with Xalatan drops.  History of chronic bronchitis with no smoking history for which he uses p.r.n. Flovent and Serevent.
What medications is he on?

He's currently taking Nexium forty M G daily for esophageal reflux, Cozaar one hundred M G and Norvasc ten M G daily for hypertension, Allegra one eighty daily for allergic rhinitis, and Flovent and Serevent as needed for recurring bronchitis.
Is he a smoker?
No.
How often does he get bronchitis?
It looks like he last had it a year ago.
I see.
He's also on Xalatan drops for glaucoma and Ativan one M G, Advair ten M G, and Paxil twenty five M G nightly for anxiety, depression, and sleep disturbances.
Okay. I think I got it all down.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Blood-borne pathogen exposure.
Please don't be scared. We will evaluate you for possible infection in blood due to accidental exposure.
I am nervous.
Oh.
Yeah.
Please don't be. We are all with you.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Appendectomy when she was 9 years old.
Have you ever had any surgeries?
I had my appendix removed when I was nine years old.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
We are planning laparoscopic surgery to take out your gall stones.
Okay. Will that be covered by my insurance?
Let me ask the staff.
Okay.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: No ill contacts.  No travel or changes in living condition.
Are you married?
Yes. I have a caring wife.
At any point did you have more than one sexual partner?
I love my wife. So no, to answer your question.
Did you travel anywhere in the recent past?
Nope.
Any changes in your living status?
No, I'm still in my sweet Casa.
Have you had any contact with anyone sick recently?
Not that I am aware of.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient was recently hospitalized for CHF exacerbation and was discharged with increased medications.  However, he did not fill his prescriptions and came back with persistent shortness of breath on exertion and on rest.  He has history of orthopnea and PND.  He has gained a few pounds of weight but denied to have any palpitation, presyncope, or syncope.
Hi there, I am looking at your report and you were recently admitted to the hospital due to worsening of your condition of congestive heart failure.
Yeah, I was.
And then you were discharged but they increased your medications, right?
Yeah, they did increase my medicines.
So, did you refill your medication?
Oh, um, no I did not.
But why?
Oh, I forgot.
Hm!
But now I am feeling shortness of breath and difficulty breathing and it's persistent.
Okay, do you feel it now?
Yes, at first it was mostly when I was climbing stairs but now even while I am resting, I have difficulty breathing.
Any nausea vomiting?
No, not really.
How is your diet? Did you gain or lose any weight?
I did gain few pounds but not so much.
Any palpitations?
No.
Okay, did you fall unconscious or felt like you might fall unconscious?
No, nothing of that sort.
You do have a history of difficulty breathing when you lay down right?
Yes, I do and I have history of shortness of breath when I sleep.
But no palpitation?
No.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: She lives with mom, sister, and her grandparent.
Do you live alone?
No. I have a whole family with me.
Who all lives with you?
My grandparents, mom, and my sister.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Cut on foot.
What brings you in today?
I was at the beach walking along the rocks. My foot slipped and I cut my foot on the barnacles.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Significant for history of seizure disorder, migraine headaches, coronary artery disease, CHF, apparently coronary stenting done, mitral valve prolapse, supraventricular tachycardia, pacemaker placement, colon cancer, and breast cancer.  None of the details of these are available.
How are your seizures?
Not good.
Okay, let me review your file here. You got some serious heart problems along with colon and breast cancer.
Yes, that's about right.
Can you tell me more about the heart issues?
Yeah. I had coronary artery disease, heart failure, mitral valve prolapse, and a very fast heart beat that is not normal.
It says here you have been dealing with migraines too. How long have you been dealing with that?
All of my life.
When you did you get your stent placed in and your pacemaker?
Maybe fifteen years ago.
Okay. I need to know more details, do we have them somewhere?
Yes, I do have them over here.
Thanks.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient is 100% compliant with her meds.  She reports she does not miss any doses.
Have you had any acne flare ups?
No.
Do you have any left over medication?
No. I took all of my pills and didn't miss any days.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: 1.  Diabetes mellitus. 2.  Neuropathy. 3.  Status post cerebrovascular accident.
So, I asked you to follow-up on your cerebrovascular accident, right?
Hm, yeah.
Okay, how are you feeling?
I am bit better but still don't feel one hundred percent.
Yeah, I understand. I am looking at your blood sugar report and-
And is it okay?
Well, you have diabetes and that explains your nerve pain. Basically, high blood sugar can cause the neuropathy.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient is accompanied with his wife.
Hi, how are you?
Doing pretty well.
Is this your wife? I don't think we've met.
Yes, let me introduce you. Doctor X, this is my wife ABC.
Hi, Doctor X, it's nice to meet you.
You as well.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient is a Mazatlan, Mexico resident, visiting her son here.
It's nice to finally meet your mom.
I know, right? I talk about her a lot, so I'm glad that she's able to meet you.
Me too. She's visiting from Mexico, correct?
Yep. She speaks very little English, but I can translate for her.
Which part of Mexico, if you don't mind me asking?
Mazatlan, Mexico.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Illnesses:  The patient had a diagnosis in 2005 of an acoustic neuroma.  It was benign, but treated neurosurgically.  In February 2004 and again in August 2009 he has had additional treatments for recurrence and he currently has some skull markers in place because radiation is planned as a followup, although the tumor was still indicated to be benign. Operations: He has a history of an old mastoidectomy.  He has a past history of removal of an acoustic neuroma in 2005 as noted. Medications:  The patient takes occasional Tylenol and occasional Aleve. Substance Use: Tobacco:  He does not smoke cigarettes. Alcohol:  He drinks about five beers a week.
Do you have any conditions that I should know about?
Yes, um, I had an acoustic neuroma in two thousand five.
Did you have surgery on this?
Yes, it was benign, but they still wanted to take it out.
Yeah, that happens. What other treatments have you had?
Um, in February of two thousand four, and August of two thousand nine I had treatments for recurrence.
Do you have skull markers in place?
Yeah, they're planning on doing radiation.
Aside from the acoustic neuroma removal, have you had any other surgeries?
Yeah, I had a mastoidectomy in the past.
What medications are you taking?
Um, I just take Tylenol and Aleve occasionally for pain.
Do you smoke?
No, I don't.
How about alcohol, do you drink?
Yes, um, I'd say about five beers a week.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: No neurologic disease in family.
Is there any medically related disease in the family?
Nope.
What about things like depression or Alzheimer's or other nerves related disorders?
Nothing that I'm aware of.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Pulmonary function studies reportedly show a mild restrictive ventilatory defect without obstruction.  Diffusing capacity is well preserved. An overnight sleep study was performed on this patient at the end of 02/07.
